verses.text: 有幾個以色列的長老來見我，在我面前坐下。

words.note: Refers to a leader or respected older member in a community or church.

verses.text: 耶和華的話就臨到我說：

words.note: Often used for a divine message or spirit coming upon someone.

verses.text: 「人子啊！這些人已經把他們的偶像接到心裡去，把那陷他們在罪孽中的絆腳石放在自己面前，我怎能讓他們向我求問呢？

words.note: A title for the prophet Ezekiel, and later for Jesus.
Used to bring the object before the verb.
Used to bring the object before the verb.
A general term for sin or evil deeds leading to misfortune.
Figuratively, something that causes one to err or fall.

verses.text: 因此，你要告訴他們，對他們說：『主耶和華這樣說：以色列家的人中，凡把他的偶像接到心裡去，把那陷自己在罪孽中的絆腳石放在自己面前，卻又來見先知的，我耶和華必按他拜眾多偶像的罪報應他，

words.note: Used to bring the object before the verb.
Used to bring the object before the verb.
One who foretells events or speaks for God.
Divine consequence for actions, often negative.

verses.text: 好奪回以色列家的心。他們眾人因自己的偶像，與我疏遠。』
「因此，你要對以色列家說：『主耶和華這樣說：回轉吧！轉離你們的偶像！轉臉離棄你們一切可憎之物吧！

words.note: Capitalized when referring to God.
Often means repentance in a religious context.
Indicates suggestion, exhortation, or command.
Here implies turning away from something in disgust or rejection.
Often used in religious contexts for abandoning sins/idols.
Literally 'things that can be hated'.
Indicates suggestion, exhortation, or command.

verses.text: 因為以色列家的人中，或是在以色列寄居的外族人中，凡與我疏遠，把他們的偶像接到心裡去，把那陷自己在罪孽中的絆腳石放在自己面前，卻又來見先知，要為自己求問我的，我耶和華必親自報應他；

words.note: Refers to living temporarily in a place, often as a foreigner.
Used to generalize about a group or condition.
Indicates movement away from the speaker or completion.
Literally 'a stone that trips the foot'.
Literally 'one who knows beforehand'.
Often used in religious contexts for seeking guidance from God or prophets.
Forms a nominal phrase 'those who inquire of me'.
Often refers to divine retribution for good or evil deeds.

verses.text: 我必向那人變臉，使他成為別人的鑒戒和譏笑的對象；我要把他從我子民中剪除；你們就知道我是耶和華。

words.note: Figuratively means to show anger or disapproval.
Refers to a cautionary example.
Refers to God's chosen people.
Strong biblical sense of being removed from the covenant community.

verses.text: 如果有先知被欺騙說一句話，是我耶和華任那先知受欺騙的；我必伸手攻擊他，把他從我子民以色列中除滅。

words.note: Literally 'one who knows beforehand'.
Literally 'one who knows beforehand'.
Emphasizes the preceding clause as a fact.
Biblical idiom for divine action or intervention.
Refers to God's chosen people.
A strong term for complete destruction or removal.

verses.text: 他們必擔當自己的罪孽；求問的人的罪孽怎樣，先知的罪孽也必怎樣。

words.note: Often used in the sense of bearing sin or punishment.
Often used in religious contexts for seeking guidance from God or prophets.
Literally 'one who knows beforehand'.

verses.text: 這樣，以色列家必不再走迷路離開我，也不再因他們的一切過犯玷污自己；他們要作我的子民，我要作他們的 神。這是主耶和華的宣告。』」

words.note: Refers to the collective people of Israel.
Refers to a chosen people or subjects.

verses.text: 耶和華的話又臨到我說：
「人子啊！如果一國行了不忠的事得罪我，我就必伸手攻擊那國，斷絕那地的糧食，使饑荒臨到那地，使人和牲畜都從那地剪除，

words.note: A title used for Ezekiel and later for Jesus in the NT.

verses.text: 即使有挪亞、但以理和約伯這三個人，他們也只能因自己的義救自己的性命。這是主耶和華的宣告。
如果我使猛獸經過那地，蹂躪那地，使它荒涼，以致因為這些獸的緣故，沒有人敢經過；

words.definition: so that, with the result that

verses.text: 即使有這三個人在其中，我指著我的永生起誓，他們只能救自己，連兒女也不能救，那地卻仍然荒涼。這是主耶和華的宣告。

words.note: Often used in religious or formal contexts of making solemn vows.
When capitalized, refers to God/Christ in Christian contexts.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Refers to a divine announcement or decree.

verses.text: 如果我使刀劍臨到那地，說：『願刀劍經過那地，好讓我把人和牲畜從那地剪除。』

words.note: Often used metaphorically for war or divine judgment in the Bible.
Often used metaphorically for war or divine judgment in the Bible.

verses.text: 即使有這三個人在其中，我指著我的永生起誓，他們只能救自己，連兒女也不能救。

words.note: Often used in religious or formal contexts of making solemn vows.

verses.text: 如果我使瘟疫流行那地，藉著流血的事把我的烈怒傾倒在那地上，使人和牲畜都從那地剪除；

words.note: Often refers to divine wrath in religious texts.

verses.text: 即使當中有挪亞、但以理和約伯，我指著我的永生起誓，他們只能因自己的義救自己的性命，連兒女也不能救。這是主耶和華的宣告。」

words.note: Often used in religious or formal contexts of making solemn vows.
Refers to moral uprightness, especially in a theological sense.
When capitalized, refers to God/Christ in Christian contexts.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Refers to a divine announcement or decree.

verses.text: 主耶和華這樣說：「我打發刀劍、饑荒、猛獸和瘟疫這四樣可怕的刑罰臨到耶路撒冷，要把人和牲畜從那裡剪除的時候，那情況豈不更嚴重嗎？

words.note: Used for rhetorical questions implying affirmation.

verses.text: 其中將有剩下逃脫的人，連同兒女被帶出來，他們來到你們那裡，你們看見他們的所行所為，就會因我降給耶路撒冷的一切災禍，得了安慰。

words.note: A formal phrase meaning 'what they have done and how they have behaved'.

verses.text: 你們看見了他們的所行所為，就必得安慰，因為你們知道我在耶路撒冷所行的一切，並不是無緣無故的。這是耶和華的宣告。」

words.note: A formal phrase meaning 'what they have done and how they have behaved'.
A nominalized phrase: 'that which (I) did'.

words.definition: is not at all, definitely not
words.note: An emphatic negation.
An idiom meaning 'for no reason at all'.
